alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 6:08PM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Flooding begins on Customs Road near mile post 6. At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. At 20.8 feet, Water covers part of Highway 21 near the intersection with Little Goosmus Creek Road between mile post 185 and 189. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 20.4 feet late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.2 feet on 05/22/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/spokane. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 615 AM PDT.
